verses.plain: O LORD, thou art my God; I will exalt thee, I will praise thy name; for thou hast done wonderful things; thy counsels of old are faithfulness and truth.

tokens.t: O
, thou
my God; I will exalt thee, I will praise thy name; for thou hast done wonderful
counsels of old
faithfulness
truth.

verses.plain: For thou hast made of a city an heap; of a defenced city a ruin: a palace of strangers to be no city; it shall never be built.

tokens.t: For thou hast made of a city an heap;
a defenced city a ruin: a palace of strangers to be no city; it shall never be built.

verses.plain: Therefore shall the strong people glorify thee, the city of the terrible nations shall fear thee.

tokens.t: Therefore shall the strong people glorify thee, the city of the terrible nations shall fear thee.

verses.plain: For thou hast been a strength to the poor, a strength to the needy in his distress, a refuge from the storm, a shadow from the heat, when the blast of the terrible ones is as a storm against the wall.

tokens.t: For thou hast been a strength to the poor, a strength to the needy in his distress, a refuge from the storm, a shadow from the heat, when the blast of the terrible ones
as a storm
the wall.

verses.plain: Thou shalt bring down the noise of strangers, as the heat in a dry place; even the heat with the shadow of a cloud: the branch of the terrible ones shall be brought low.

tokens.t: Thou shalt bring down the noise of strangers, as the heat in a dry place;
the heat with the shadow of a cloud: the branch of the terrible ones shall be brought low.

verses.plain: ¶ And in this mountain shall the LORD of hosts make unto all people a feast of fat things, a feast of wines on the lees, of fat things full of marrow, of wines on the lees well refined.

tokens.t: ¶ And in this mountain shall the
of hosts make unto all people a feast of fat things, a feast of wines on the lees, of fat things full of marrow, of wines on the lees well refined.

verses.plain: And he will destroy in this mountain the face of the covering cast over all people, and the vail that is spread over all nations.

tokens.t: And he will destroy in this mountain the face of the covering cast over all people, and the vail that is spread over all nations.

verses.plain: He will swallow up death in victory; and the Lord GOD will wipe away tears from off all faces; and the rebuke of his people shall he take away from off all the earth: for the LORD hath spoken it.

tokens.t: He will swallow up death in victory; and the Lord
will wipe away tears from off all faces; and the rebuke of his people shall he take away from off all the earth: for the
hath spoken

verses.plain: ¶ And it shall be said in that day, Lo, this is our God; we have waited for him, and he will save us: this is the LORD; we have waited for him, we will be glad and rejoice in his salvation.

tokens.t: ¶ And it shall be said in that day, Lo, this
our God; we have waited for him, and he will save us: this
the
; we have waited for him, we will be glad and rejoice in his salvation.

verses.plain: For in this mountain shall the hand of the LORD rest, and Moab shall be trodden down under him, even as straw is trodden down for the dunghill.

tokens.t: For in this mountain shall the hand of the
rest, and Moab shall be trodden down under him, even as straw is trodden down for the dunghill.

verses.plain: And he shall spread forth his hands in the midst of them, as he that swimmeth spreadeth forth his hands to swim: and he shall bring down their pride together with the spoils of their hands.

tokens.t: And he shall spread forth his hands in the midst of them, as he that swimmeth spreadeth forth
to swim: and he shall bring down their pride together with the spoils of their hands.

verses.plain: And the fortress of the high fort of thy walls shall he bring down, lay low, and bring to the ground, even to the dust.

tokens.t: And the fortress of the high fort of thy walls shall he bring down, lay low,
bring to the ground,
to the dust.

footnotes.text: trodden down under: or, threshed, etc
trodden down for…: or, threshed in Madmenah
